ml.alternet.security.web.server

Class CaptureContext<T>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ml.alternet.security.web.server.CaptureContext<T>
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Destroyable

    public class CaptureContext<T>
extends Object
implements Destroyable
    If the incoming request URI matches the path configured, this capture context will be set while handling the request for capturing the passwords.
    Author:
    Philippe Poulard

    • Field Summary

      Fields 
      Modifier and Type Field and Description
      T writableInputBuffer
      Contains the input source ; it has to be writable in order to replace the read bytes with '*' when necessary.

    • Constructor Summary

      Create a capture context.

      void add(String name, Password newPassword)
      Append a password that have been captured to this context.
      Passwords asPasswords()
      Return all the passwords that have been captured ; the passwords can be retrieved by their name and may be multi-valued.

    • Field Detail

      • writableInputBuffer

        public T writableInputBuffer
        Contains the input source ; it has to be writable in order to replace the read bytes with '*' when necessary.

    • Constructor Detail

      • CaptureContext

        public CaptureContext(List<String> fields)
        Create a capture context.
        Parameters:
        fields - The list of fields to capture, e.g. "pwd", "oldPwd", "newPwd", etc

    • Method Detail

      • add

        public void add(String name,
                Password newPassword)
        Append a password that have been captured to this context.
        Parameters:
        name - The field name.
        newPassword - The password.

      • asPasswords

        public Passwords asPasswords()
        Return all the passwords that have been captured ; the passwords can be retrieved by their name and may be multi-valued. This method can be invoked at the end of the capture phase.
        Returns:
        The passwords that have been captured.
